III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and develoPM1ental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/1/23, youth was held down on the ground by staff during
restraint. One staff grabbed youth's neck with both hands. Youth
has multiple bruises as a result of the restraint. Staff had their
genitals close to youth's face and genitals.
Investigation On 03/02/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth A
at Vassar House. The DHHS specialist was also present. Youth
A reported that she did not feel safe at the facility last night as
several staff were around her all day and a DHHS specialist had
visited her at the agency and said none of them should be around
her. She denied that any of the staff had done anything to harm
her last night but reiterated that she did not want them around her.
Youth A reported she got restrained yesterday because she tried
to go AWOL. She stated that she left Vassar house and was
running toward Clarence Fisher Center (CFC). She reported Staff
4 and Program Manager 1 (PM1) tried to grab her, and she
started swinging on PM1. She reported that staff then took her
down to the ground. She reported that one arm was held by Staff
4, the other by Staff 6 and Staff 8 was on her legs. She confirmed
2

that she was resisting the restraint. Youth A then stated that Staff
8 was mostly on her thigh area and his “private parts” touched her
“private parts”. She was asked if Staff 8 was on her pelvic area or
her legs and she stated he had one leg over her legs and the rest
of his body was near her thigh area. She reported that she then
started screaming and staff attempted to redirect her. Youth A
stated she started having flashbacks of when she was raped. She
began yelling and told all male staff to get off of her. Youth A
reported that she felt like all the male staff were going to rape and
sexually harass her. She further stated that because of what
happened yesterday, she does not want male staff around her.
Youth A reported the restraint lasted for over an hour. She
reported she kept yelling and screaming because she was having
flashbacks. She confirmed the male staff got off of her and female
staff stepped in to assist with the restraint. Youth A reported PM1
grabbed her shirt, twisted it and then pushed in. She reported she
told her “You need to shut the fuck up" and took her hands and
choked her around the neck. Youth A reported that she told PM1
that she was choking her and PM1 looked up at the other staff and
said she was not choking her, but rather holding her head down.
Youth A reported she had a red mark on her neck. However,
there were no visible marks or bruises on Youth A. She reported
she continued to scream and try to “swing on” staff. She recalled
the ambulance came, she was hyperventilating, and they took her
to the hospital. Youth A reported that she was “in pain
everywhere” and the hospital gave her a shot because she asked
for one. She denied that there were any other youth outside while
she was in the restraint. She was later discharged and returned to
Vassar House.
Youth A reported that she was previously in Unit 4 but has been
moved to Unit 3. She stated that she does not want to be in that
unit anymore. She said that Youth F is saying that she is going to
slit her throat in her sleep and Youth A is saying she is going to
commit suicide. She confirmed that staff are aware and safety
plans are in place but stated staff only sit on their phones. She
said the staff only act like they're working when DHHS and
licensing come out, the rest of the time they're on their phones.
Youth A reported that she has refused to go back into Unit 3 since
she came from the hospital. She reported that one night she slept
in Unit 1 and another night she slept in the sensory room. She
confirmed that she was always monitored by staff. Youth A then
reported that earlier today she went into the supervisor office
without permission because she was trying to get away from Staff
7 who was trying to get her to talk to her dad on the phone. She
stated that Staff 5 was also present because she was refusing to
3

come out of the office. He was pushing her on her back and trying
to ger her to leave the office and his hand “slid down onto my
butt”. Youth A yelled for him to get off of her or threaten to hit him.
She reported that Staff 7 and Staff 2 were also in the office and
saw everything but would stick up for staff. Youth A was asked if
she thought Staff 5 touched her butt intentionally and she replied,
“I don’t know”. She also reported that Staff 2 got into her face.
She stated that Staff 5 was in the front of her and then Staff 2
yelled in her face that she needed to get out of the office because
there were things in the office that were not safe. She reported
Staff 2 was grabbing at her sweatshirt sleeve and Youth A
threatened to hit her and walked out of the office. Youth A was
asked how Staff 5 touched her back and butt if he was standing in
front of her and she replied that he did it prior to standing in front.
Youth A denied that Staff 5 has ever done anything to make her
feel like he was going to rape her or sexually harass her. She
reported that he did grab her arm once and she stated that she
just doesn’t like him. Youth A denied being aware of Staff 5 being
inappropriate with other youth in the program. She further shared
that she does not like Staff 11 because he is too tall and is creepy
and doesn’t like Staff 1 because he was on her legs during a
restraint.
On 03/02/2023 an in-person interview was held with the
complainant. No additional concerns were expressed.
On 03/02/2023 an in-person interview was held with the
Clinical Director. The DHHS specialist was also present. She
advised that Youth A has been “putting her hands” on people all
day. She was informed of the allegations and agreed to a safety
plan that involved staff not being alone with Youth A. Copies of
3/01/23 medical records of Youth A, incident reports for Youth A
and copies of the logbook were provided for review.
On 03/06/2023 a phone call was made to Complaint 2.
Information was provided regarding the initial concerns reported.
No additional concerns were noted.
On 03/07/2023 an in-person interview was held with the Chief
Administrator (CA) at Vassar House. The DHHS specialist was
also present. He advised that he was present for most of the
restraint. He stated that Youth A would not calm down, so the
restraint went on for some time. He acknowledged that Youth A
was screaming and stating that she did not want men on her and
stated he responded by rotating any men involved in the restraint
out and replaced them with other female staff. He reported that
4

Youth a was spitting during the restraint and due to the absence of
spit guards, staff lifted her sweatshirt to block the spit. He
demonstrated how the sweatshirt was held up and stated that they
made sure her face was unobstructed, still visible and her air was
not blocked. CA stated that everything was done appropriately
during the restraint. He stated staff was placed at her arms and
legs. He acknowledged that on some occasions, there may have
been two staff on the legs due to how aggressive Youth A was.
He denied any staff were laying across her genital area. He also
denied witnessing any staff choke Youth A or put their privates in
her face. On 03/23/2023 an in-person interview was held with CA
again at Vassar. The DHHS specialist was also present. CA
denied that he took pictures or videoed the restraint.
On 03/07/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 4 at
Vassar House. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 4
reported that she was the assigned one-to-one staff for Youth A
on this day and that Youth A was having a good day. After school
Youth A was to switch units and would be assigned to Unit 3. She
was upset about it and wanted to go to Unit 1, but it was closed
and not an option. Youth A became angry and after not wanting
anyone to touch her personal items walked out to the parking lot
of Vassar and stated she was going to “her spot”. This is an area
of the parking lot that Youth A has been known to go and sit in
and refuse redirection from the staff. It was noted that there was
an incident with Youth A in that “spot” the day before. Staff 4
reported that she and Staff 6 followed Youth A to the parking lot.
Youth A was sitting on the ground and staff were attempting to
negotiate with her to calm down and return inside. Youth A was
not listening, got up and stated she was going to hitch hike. She
then ran into the woods and Staff 4 said that she followed with the
other staff behind her. Youth A was able to make it over to CFC
and staff followed closely. When Youth A arrived at CFC she then
took off her socks and shoes and as staff approached, she began
to swing at, hit and threaten staff. Staff 4 described Youth A as
being “belligerent and assaultive”. Youth A was then placed in a
standing restraint, however continued to fight during the restraint.
Staff 4 reported that Youth A was lifting and kicking her legs and
dropping to the ground. She was then placed in a team restraint
and continued to make attempts to fight with staff. Staff 4 recalled
that a youth from CFC was looking out of one of the doors and
then ran off into the wooded area and CFC staff followed. Staff 4
also reported that Youth A was spitting at staff. The staff did not
have any spit guards available and was not able to obtain any
from CFC. Staff 4 reported that staff held up the sweatshirt of
Youth A from the collar area and used it as a shield. It was
5

confirmed that the shirt was not covering the mouth of Youth A
and she was still able to breath and speak. Staff 4 reported that
some staff members from CFC arrived to assist in the restraint.
When male staff were involved in the restraint, Youth A was
yelling that she didn't want male staff on her, so the staff switched
out again to all female staff. Staff 4 reported that attempts were
made to release Youth A from the restraint, however each time
she would continue with the aggression and continued to threaten
to run. She reported that the restraint lasted for about one hour
and staff had to switch out with each other for relief. Staff 4
reported that there was never more than four staff involved in the
restraint at one time. She stated that due to the aggression of
Youth A, it sometimes took two staff to contain her legs. Staff 4
denied seeing any staff, male or female, restrain Youth A in the
“thigh area”. She denied that staff grabbed Youth A by the neck
and denied seeing staff push her head to the ground. Staff 4
reported that Youth A was banging her head on the cement, and
she placed her hand in the back of the head of Youth A to prevent
her from hurting herself. Staff 4 also denied that Youth A
complained of any pain or stated that any male staff had been
inappropriate with her. She was only screaming that she had
asthma. Staff 4 stated that a staff ran to get her inhaler. Lastly,
Staff 4 denied ever seeing Staff 5 be inappropriate with Youth A or
any other youth and also denied seeing any staff be abusive
toward Youth A. When the ambulance and police arrived, Youth A
eventually got up from the ground and voluntarily went to the
hospital with them for an assessment.
On 03/07/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 5.
The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 5 reported that
Youth A was in the supervisor office and was refusing to leave.
Staff 2 called him to the office to assist. Staff 5 stepped in the
office on the other side of Youth A and removed items he
determined could present as a risk for Youth A. Staff 7 was also
present in the office attempting to redirect Youth A out of the
office. Staff 5 stated that Youth A finally went to walk out of the
office and then immediately stepped back. Because he had
extended his hand to attempt to make sure that Youth A did not
re-enter the office, she stepped back into his hand, and it touched
the small of her back (between her shoulder blades). Staff 5
reported that he immediately removed his hand. He reported that
Youth A yelled “don’t touch me” and he replied okay, and she
exited the office. Staff 5 reported that both Staff 7 and Staff 2
were also in the office and that he was never alone with Youth A.
Staff 5 denied that he has ever inappropriately or sexually touched
any female youth in the program. He also denied that he has ever
6

seen any other male staff be inappropriate or sexually touch any
female youth in the program.
On 03/07/2023 an in-person meeting was held with the
Program Manager 1 (PM1). The DHHS specialist was present
also. PM1 reported that Youth A was acting out in the parking lot
and Staff 6 knocked on the window and requested that PM1 come
out to assist. Both PM1 and CA went out. Youth A was upset
because she did not want to change units and PM1 reported that
staff were attempting to convince her that she cannot stay in the
unit alone. PM1 reported Youth A was not listening to any staff
and continued to sit out in the parking lot of Vassar House. Youth
A then stated that she was going to go hitch hike and took off
toward CFC. PM1 reported that Staff 4 got to Youth A first and
was trying to talk with her. PM1 walked up and she reported that
Youth A began swinging on both staff. Youth A was placed in a
standing restraint but continued to fight. Other staff were arriving,
and Youth A was transitioned into a supine/team restraint. Youth
A began to yell and stated that she was being touched
inappropriately and she was going to call CPS and PREA. PM1
stated that Youth A continued to be aggressive, and the restraint
lasted for almost an hour, which required staff to be switched out.
PM1 stated that Staff 1 and Staff 12 were present and assisting
with the restraint. She reported that there was another male staff
from CFC and she did not know his name. PM1 reported that she
was monitoring to make sure that everything was being done
correctly and was having the female staff to rotate out the male
staff since Youth A was expressing concerns. PM1 reported that
Youth A began spitting and Staff 6 held up her sweatshirt to block
the spit from getting on staff. PM1 confirmed that the sweatshirt
did not block the airway of Youth A. Youth A was yelling that she
was suffocating and that she had asthma, so another staff ran
back to Vassar House to get her inhaler. PM1 reported that staff
attempted to allow Youth A out of the restraint several times, but
she continued her aggression, so the restraint was continued.
PM1 reported that male staff were rotated in an out of the restraint
as quickly as possible. She confirmed that at one point Staff 1
was on both legs (below the knee) of Youth A but could not recall
the position of the other male staff that was present. PM1 denied
that Staff 1 or any other staff was in the thigh area of Youth A.
PM1 further denied that she saw any staff being inappropriate with
Youth A during the restraint. The ambulance and police arrived
on scene and Youth A was transported to the hospital for an
evaluation. PM1 reported that she rode to hospital with Youth A.
7

On 03/07/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 6.
The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 6 reported that after
school Youth A wanted to return to Unit 1 and was upset because
she had been assigned to Unit 3. She refused to go to Unit 3 and
then stated that “I’ll just go to my spot” which was outside in the
parking lot of Vassar House. Staff 4 followed behind Youth A and
Staff 6 reported that she knocked on the window and requested
assistance from other staff. PM1 and CA came outside and tried
to redirect Youth A without success. Youth A then stated that she
was going to go hitch hike and started running through the
wooded area toward CFC. Staff 6 reported that staff followed,
caught up with her, she took off her shoes and socks and then
began hitting Staff 4 and PM1. Youth A was then placed in a
standing hold, but she continued to fight and was trying to hit her
head, so they transitioned into a supine/team restraint. Staff 6
recalled that Youth A was yelling PREA and that staff were hurting
her. Staff 6 noticed that the shirt of Youth A kept rising up so Staff
4 placed a jacket over her stomach area to attempt to cover her.
Youth A continued to threaten staff and be aggressive. Staff 6
reported that staff began switching out with each other because
the restraint was taking a while. She confirmed that Staff 8,
Program Manager 2 (PM2), Staff 1, Staff 3 and PM1 were the staff
that she recalled were present. She recalled that Staff 1 and Staff
8 were both assisting with the arms of Youth A at some time
during the restraint. Staff 6 reported that Youth A was yelling that
male staff could not touch her and staff worked to transition the
male staff out of the restraint and use all female staff. Staff 6
denied seeing Staff 1 or Staff 8 restraining Youth A and being in
her thigh area or placing their genitals close to her. She further
denied seeing any staff be inappropriate with Youth A during the
restraint or seeing any female or male staff touching Youth A in an
inappropriate sexual manner. Staff 6 reported that there were no
more than four staff involved in the restraint at any time.
On 03/07/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 1 at
Vassar House. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 1 is
a residential care supervisor at Vassar and reported that he has
been employed with the agency for almost 22 years. He reported
that he arrived at CFC and Youth A was in a restraint. He
reported that he relieved Staff 12, assisted with the left arm and
then Youth A yelled that she did not want male staff on her. Staff
1 stated that he was then relieved but didn’t recall by which staff.
After being relieved, Staff 1 reported that he was no longer
involved in the restraint. He denied being in the “thigh area” of
Youth A during the restraint. He denied seeing any male or
female staff be sexually inappropriate with Youth A and denied
8

that she was exposed in any way during the restraint. Staff 1
further denied any staff genitals being placed in the face of Youth
A. He lastly confirmed staff utilized her sweatshirt to block her
from spitting on staff. He confirmed that the sweatshirt was just
held to block spit from coming from her mouth and denied that it
restricted her from breathing in anyway.
On 03/07/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at
Vassar House. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 2
reported that she was not involved in the restraint with Youth A at
CFC. Staff 2 recalled that Youth A was “all over the place” that
day and was in the hallway with another youth doing whatever she
wanted to do. Staff 2 reported that Youth A was making
allegations that staff were raping her, and this made staff afraid to
touch Youth A. Staff 2 recalled the incident when Youth A refused
to come out of the supervisor office. She reported that Staff 5,
Staff 7 and herself were present in the supervisor’s office. She
recalled that Youth A went into the office looking for items to hurt
herself. Staff 5 was removing items that he thought could pose a
risk for Youth A. Staff 2 reported that Youth A backed into her and
then started yelling that she was being raped. Staff 5 was
attempting to calm Youth A and reassure her that no one was
raping her and that she was safe. Youth A continued to be unruly
and then went to walk out of the office. Staff 2 denied that Youth
A made any allegations about Staff 5 at that time. She also
denied that she, or any other staff, pushed Youth A. Staff 2
reported that she denied seeing Staff 5 touch Youth A in an
inappropriate manner and denied seeing any other staff either.
Lastly, Staff 2 denied grabbing the sleeve of Youth A and denied
that she made a threat to hit her.
On 03/07/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 3 at
Vassar House. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 3
confirmed that she was working on the date of the incident and
was involved in the restraint. Staff 3 reported that she was called
to assist with the restraint. She recalled that she relieved a staff
who was unknown to her, who was on the leg area of Youth A.
Staff 3 reported that Youth A was yelling, “it’s a man on me”, Staff
3 advised that she only saw one male participating in the restraint
and he was assisting with the arms of Youth A. Staff 3 recalled
that the staff had to switch out with each other because it was
taking so long. The police and ambulance arrived, and Youth A
went to the hospital for a medical and mental evaluation. Staff 3
denied that staff was being inappropriate with Youth A and denied
seeing anyone (specifically the male) in the thigh area of Youth A.
She further denied that any staff had their genitals in the face of
9

Youth A. Staff 3 reported that the restraint was done correctly and
that the staff assisting with the legs were appropriately positioned
below the knee. Staff 3 also provided the same report regarding
use of the sweatshirt by Staff 3. She denied that the mouth of
Youth A was covered, and her airway was clear.
On 03/07/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 7 at
Vassar House. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 7
reported that Youth A was checking doors to see what doors were
unlocked and entered the supervisor office. Staff 7 called, and
Staff 2 and Staff 5 came to assist. Staff 5 removed items off the
desk that may have posed a risk for Youth A. Staff 7 reported that
Youth A began to push items off the desk. Staff 7 raised her hand
to stop Youth A from throwing things and Youth A began to yell
PREA and you can’t touch me. Youth A also stated that she
wanted to call CPS and was advised that she would be able to call
once she calmed down. Staff 7 denied that Youth A made any
allegations regarding Staff 5 at that time. Staff 7 also denied
seeing Staff 5 touch the butt of Youth A or any staff being
inappropriate with Youth A. Staff 5 further denied that she or any
other staff pulled Youth A by the hair. Staff 5 specifically recalled
that all the staff present had their hands in their pockets and Youth
A was still yelling that staff was touching her.
On 03/07/2023 an in-person interview was held with PM2 at
CFC. The DHHS specialist was also present. PM2 confirmed that
she was present at CFC when Youth A was restrained. She
reported that the CA requested that she assist and relieve one of
the staff that were engaged in the restraint. PM2 relieved Staff 8
who was on the left arm. PM2 denied seeing any inappropriate
actions during the restraint and denied that any staff genitals were
in Youth A’s face. PM2 lastly denied that anyone was
inappropriate or sexually touching Youth A.
On 03/07/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 8 at
CFC. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 8 reported
that it was a “crazy” day. He recalled that he was following Youth
E outside and saw Vassar staff engaged in a restraint. He later
found out it was Youth A and stated that she was in a supine/team
restraint. Staff 8 reported that he stepped in and relieved PM1.
Youth A was yelling and screaming and then started to say that
Staff 8 was touching her inappropriately. CA had Staff 8 switch
out and only female staff were engaged in the restraint. Youth A
continued to be aggressive and kick at staff. Staff 8 reported that
he had to assist in the restraint again but was quickly switched out
because Youth A began to make allegations again. He reported
10

that Youth A was yelling that she was going to slit everyone’s
throat and begin spitting toward the staff. He recalled that he ran
to Vassar to get Youth A’s inhaler as she began to say that she
was wheezing and suffocating. Staff 8 reported that he remained
right above the knees of Youth A during the restraint. He denied
CA was involved in the restraint. Staff 8 denied that any staff had
their genitals in the face of Youth A and denied that any staff were
inappropriate during the restraint. Staff 8 confirmed that a
sweatshirt was used as a spit guard when Youth A was spitting on
staff. He denied that it covered her mouth or obstructed her
breathing.
On 03/23/2023 and in-person meeting was held with Staff 13
at CFC. The DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 13 reported
that there were a lot of staff outside during the restraint, but only
three staff were involved at any given time. He recalled being
involved in the restraint about 3 to 4 minutes total. Youth A was
screaming and saying that she did not feel comfortable with male
staff touching her. Staff 13 reported when possible, male staff
would rotate out and only female staff would be involved. He
recalled that Youth A was spitting at staff, but stated that
something was used to block the spit but wasn’t covering the
mouth of Youth A. He denied seeing any male or female staff
placing their genitals in the face of Youth A and denied that
anyone used a cell phone to record footage. Staff 13 stated that
CA was outside during the restraint and monitored to make sure
everything was done appropriately. Staff 13 stated he returned to
the unit once they were no longer utilizing any male staff.
On 03/23/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth B.
The DHHS specialist was also present. Youth B reported that he
is assigned to Unit 3. He stated that he recalled seeing Youth A
being restrained right outside of the door. He reported seeing
staff push the face of Youth A to the ground and heard her keep
saying that she could not breathe. He confirmed that Youth A was
talking, but stated he did not know if she passed out. Youth B
also reported that it looked as if Youth A was bleeding from her
forehead. He reported that a total of four staff were on Youth A
during the restraint. He recalled that one was on each arm and
one on each leg. Youth B then reported that it was 4 or 5 staff
involved in restraint and they were focused on her legs and arms.
When Youth B was asked to confirm, he stated he was not sure.
Youth B reported that the staff was holding the face of Youth A
down into the ground and that CA was taking videos or
photographs of Youth A. Youth B denied seeing Youth A on her
back and only recalled seeing her face down. He reported that he
11

was able to view the restraint for about two minutes and CA told
him to go back inside.
On 03/23/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Youth C at
CFC. The DHHS specialist was also present. Youth C denied
hearing, seeing or knowing anything regarding the restraint that
occurred with Youth A.
On 03/23/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Youth D at
CFC. The DHHS specialist was also present. Youth D reported
that he was in the unit and heard a girl yelling, went to the door
and opened it. An unknown staff instructed Youth D to close the
door. Youth D reported that he could still see the yellow
supervisor shirts through the film on the window. He reported that
there were a lot of staff outside and Youth A continued to yell and
scream. He recalled that Youth A was yelling “get off me”. Youth
D reported that the restraint lasted for about 10 – 15 minutes. He
denied seeing staff doing anything with her sweatshirt. He also
denied seeing Youth A do anything except try to “wiggle” from the
staff. Lastly Youth D denied seeing any staff place their genitals
in the face of Youth A or place their hands around her neck.
The following documents were reviewed during the investigation:
• Pictures of the neck and arm areas of Youth A from
3/4/2023: No visible bruises were noted.
• 03/01/23 Medical report of Youth A. She was evaluated on
03/01/23 at 6:05PM1n. “PT is a 14-year-old female
presenting with history. Crisis will come and evaluate the
patient and the patient was provided IM Toradol for
symptomatic relief. She does not appear to be an acute
threat to others and will therefore be sent back with the
staff to Wolverine house. She will be monitored one on
one. Patient and staff were informed of this plan of care
and are agreeable at this time. They were given strict
return precautions and expressed understanding. All
questions were answered”.
On 04/06/2023 a virtual DHHS closing case conference was held.
No findings were made against the agency.
On 03/03/2023 an email correspondence was received from
DHHS Specialist 2. She expressed concern regarding Youth A
sleeping on the floor one night and none of her belongings being
in the p-aisle assigned to her in Unit 3. An email response was
sent advising that Youth A was refusing to go into Unit 3 and slept
12

on the floor on her own, because she refused to go into her
assigned unit.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rules. Interviews were completed
with both youth and staff involved in the incident and there was no
evidence to support that the restraint was not completed
appropriately. Pictures of the youth were available from that night
